707048f-a.title: Brooklyn: Throop Ave. - Hart St.
707048f-a.text:
(1)
Throop Ave., west side, north from, but not including Hart to
Willoughby Streets, showing the Throop Ave. Presbyterian Church, which
had its origin in a mission established in 1852, on the corner of Throop
Ave., and Bartlett Street. The church as such was organized on June
B, 1862, at Throop Ave., near Hopkins Street. I1 1867 it moved to a
small frame building at the S.W. corner of Throop and Willoughby Aves.
The cornerstone of this building, was laid on November 2, 1889. A part
of the wall fell during a storm on 'anuary 9, 1890. The edifice was
opened for service on November 2, 1890; shortly thereafter it was destroy-
ed by fire. A new site was later acduired at the corner of Throop
Ave., and Macon Street.
October 12, 1911.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
